history.text: hey
Hello.
This will be in regards to Batman Begins.
correct
its been a while since ive seen this movie.
have you seen it?
It's from 2005 which has Christian Bale playing Batman.
Liam neeson is the main antagonist Ra's al Ghul.
It was directed by Christopher Nolan.
I have seen it several times.
ok yeah i recall this movie well. thanks for refreshing my mind.
I really liked how nolan directed the batman films.
it had a dark touch to it.
Yes.  The critics were very high on it too.
It starts off with Bruce Wayne as a child falling down a well.
and then getting attacked by bats.
I think he is actually terrified of bats at first if im not mistaken.
Also i think early in the movie his parents are killed.
Yes after that bat incident they are at an opera.
Bruce sees the people dancing around in masks, reminds him of his bat experience and asks his parents to leave the opera.
Yes
All these scene pretty much set the foundation for the movie and sequels.
Then it fast forwards to Bruce carrying a gun to court with the intention on killing the man who murdered his parents.
I think the next set of scene pretty much establish how  batman starts to turn into the man in the mask.
Yes, he ends up not killing the man, and one of the mafia bosses goons kills him
Do you recall when he starts training?
While serving a prison sentance for stealing.
After the training he pretty much becomes Batman.
Intercepts a drug shipment trying to assist Rachel with evidence against Carmine Falcone.

I think this is when we get introduced
 to the scarecrow.
That kind of ends up backfiring as Falcone meets Dr. Crane (Scarecrow) and they work together to get scarecrows drug out
These next few scene are difficult for me to remember.
Batman gets exposed to the drug and it has a terrible effect on him leaving him incapacitated, until Alfred gives him an antidote created by Lucious Fox.
Rachel also gets exposed to the drug as well at some point.
They find out Crane has dumped the drug into Gothams water supply with the plan on vaporizing the water supply making the drug air borne.
ok well i think we are finished here.

uid2response.feedback: The user was active but not really engaging in a smooth conversation with reciprocity.
